info.description: All resource groups and resources exist within subscriptions. These operation enable you get information about your subscriptions and tenants. A tenant is a dedicated instance of Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) for your organization.
info.title: SubscriptionClient

get.description: Lists all of the available Microsoft.Resources REST API operations.

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

schema.description: Result of the request to list Microsoft.Resources operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Profile, endpoint, etc.

get.description: Gets all subscriptions for a tenant.

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: OK - Returns an array of subscriptions.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

authorizationSource.description: The authorization source of the request. Valid values are one or more combinations of Legacy, RoleBased, Bypassed, Direct and Management. For example, 'Legacy, RoleBased'.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the subscription. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

state.description: The subscription state. Possible values are Enabled, Warned, PastDue, Disabled, and Deleted.

locationPlacementId.description: The subscription location placement ID. The ID indicates which regions are visible for a subscription. For example, a subscription with a location placement Id of Public_2014-09-01 has access to Azure public regions.

get.description: Gets details about a specified subscription.

parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: OK - Returns information about the subscription.

authorizationSource.description: The authorization source of the request. Valid values are one or more combinations of Legacy, RoleBased, Bypassed, Direct and Management. For example, 'Legacy, RoleBased'.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the subscription. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

state.description: The subscription state. Possible values are Enabled, Warned, PastDue, Disabled, and Deleted.

locationPlacementId.description: The subscription location placement ID. The ID indicates which regions are visible for a subscription. For example, a subscription with a location placement Id of Public_2014-09-01 has access to Azure public regions.

get.description: This operation provides all the locations that are available for resource providers; however, each resource provider may support a subset of this list.

parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: OK - Returns an array of locations.

displayName.description: The display name of the location.

id.description: The fully qualified ID of the location. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/locations/westus.

get.description: Gets the tenants for your account.

parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: OK - Returns an array of tenants.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

id.description: The fully qualified ID of the tenant. For example, /tenants/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

displayName.description: The display name of the location.

id.description: The fully qualified ID of the location. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/locations/westus.

id.description: The fully qualified ID of the location. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/locations/westus.
